pullRequest.body:
Let $R : C^{op} \to Ring$ be a sheaf of rings and $M$ a sheaf of $R$-modules. Then $M$ is naturally a sheaf of $R(\top)$-modules where $\top$ is an initial object.

In the case of a sheafed space $X$, for any $x \in X$ and $M$ a sheaf of $\mathcal{O} _X$-modules, then $M$ is also a sheaf of $\Gamma(\mathcal{O} _X, X)$-modules; thus we can take stalks to naturally have that $M_x$ is a $\Gamma(\mathcal{O} _X, X)$-module. Thus we can use this construction to define $M_x$ as a module over $\mathcal{O} _{X, x}$.

Co-authored-by: Sophie Morel <sophie.morel@ens-lyon.fr>

---

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9955071340/job/27502045333)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9955071340/job/27502044891)
Here, you should use `ModuleCat.restrictScalars` applied to the obvious map of rings and the object `M.obj c`.
Thanks!

Instead of `isSheaf_iff_isSheaf_forget`, I feel it should be possible to apply `isSheaf_iff_isSheaf_comp`(?) to the `forget₂` functor from modules to abelian groups. Then, the goal should be proved `by exact M.isSheaf`.

Thanks `isSheaf_iff_isSheaf_comp` indeed works, but I needed to introduce some extra universe constraint. Can you check if this is acceptable please?

```lean
@[simps]
noncomputable def forgetToSheafModuleCat [UnivLE.{max v₁ u₁, w}]
      (X : Cᵒᵖ) (hX : Limits.IsInitial X)  :
    SheafOfModules R ⥤ Sheaf J (ModuleCat (R.1.obj X)) where
  obj M := ⟨(PresheafOfModules.forgetToPresheafModuleCat X hX).obj M.1, by
    have := ModuleCat.hasLimitsOfSize.{max v₁ u₁, w} (R := R.1.obj X)
    exact CategoryTheory.Presheaf.isSheaf_iff_isSheaf_comp J
      ((PresheafOfModules.forgetToPresheafModuleCat X hX).obj M.1)
      (forget₂ (ModuleCat.{w} (R.1.obj X)) AddCommGrp.{w}) |>.2 M.isSheaf⟩
  map f := { val := (PresheafOfModules.forgetToPresheafModuleCat X hX).map f.1 }
```

Could you make explicit the universe `w` in the statement: `SheafOfModules.{w} R ⥤ ...`?

I do not think that your previous version was not more general, because by writing `CategoryTheory.forget.{max v₁ u₁}` in the proof, it was forcing `w := max v₁ u₁`. For the applications to topological spaces (e.g. schemes), this is general enough. (Since I have shown that a limit in `AddCommGrp` exists iff a certain type is small, I think that `forget₂ (ModuleCat _) (AddCommGrp)` reflects all limits, regardless of universes for the index categories. Then, `forgetToSheafModuleCat` should be defined regardless of the universes, but I do not feel it is necessary to do it now!)

In #14283, I show that the forget functor from `ModuleCat` to `AddCommGrp` reflects all limits (regardless of universes) [for the preservation we may need that the ring is `v`-small]. Then, I think that you may now use `isSheaf_of_isSheaf_comp` applied to this `forget₂` in order to remove universe restrictions.
Thanks! This works perfectly!

This syntax is more convenient:
```suggestion
    Cᵒᵖ ⥤ ModuleCat (R.1.obj X) where
  obj c :=
```

Should there be `simps` on this?
```suggestion
@[simps]
noncomputable def forgetToPresheafModuleCatMap
```
The generated `simp`-lemma gives a `simpNF`-linter error

And here?
```suggestion
@[simps]
noncomputable def forgetToPresheafModuleCat (X : Cᵒᵖ) (hX : Limits.IsInitial X) :
```
Are we missing (d)simp lemmas to get the goal in the right shape? I would prefer if we could avoid `change`.
This is resolved by explicitly tell Lean `m : ModuleCat.restrictScalars ....`
Idem
This is resolved
Idem
This is resolved

```suggestion
-- `@[simps]` here is not needed,
-- and in any case produces lemmas that the `simpNF` linter complains about.
noncomputable def forgetToPresheafModuleCatMap
```
Just so future readers don't miss it!
